Method Detail

setForceVector

public void setForceVector(Vector2f vec)
Description copied from class: Force
Sets the vector for this force. A vector may hold different meanings depending on the force; i.e a force vector might be acceleration, energy, etc. or just straight force in Newtons.

Specified by:
setForceVector in class Force
Parameters:
vec - the new force direction and magnitude.

getNewtonForce

public double getNewtonForce(double mass)
F = ma The newton force exerted by gravity depends on the mass of the object. Therefore, the force (in N) is determined by multiplying the given mass value by the value of gravity's acceleration.

Specified by:
getNewtonForce in class Force
Parameters:
mass - mass of the object in Kg (required).
Returns:
the force exerted on the object with the given mass in Newtons (N).

applyTo

public Vector2f applyTo(float time,
                        float mass,
                        Vector2f forceSum,
                        Vector2f vec)
Applies the forces of this Gravity object to the given Vector2f.

Overrides:
applyTo in class Force
Parameters:
time - seconds to accelerate the given vector
mass - of the object in Kg. Irrelevant for gravitational force.
vec - velocity vector to be accelerated by Gravity.
forceSum - some Forces may require a sum of other forces also being applied at at the current time interval. This argument is optional, thus all implementations should account for possible null values.
Returns:
the modified Vector2f object (allows for chain calls).

applyTo

public Vector2d applyTo(double time,
                        double mass,
                        Vector2d forceSum,
                        Vector2d vec)
Applies the forces of this Gravity object to the given Vector2d.

Overrides:
applyTo in class Force
Parameters:
time - seconds to accelerate the given vector (assumed to be velocity).
mass - of the object in Kg. Irrelevant for gravitational force.
vec - velocity vector to be accelerated by Gravity.
forceSum - some Forces may require a sum of other forces also being applied at at the current time interval. This argument is optional, thus all implementations should account for possible null values.
Returns:
the modified Vector2d object (allows for chain calls).
